question: What should you do when approaching a stop sign?
option1: A) Slow down and proceed if no cars are coming
option2: B) Stop completely at the stop line, crosswalk, or intersection
option3: C) Only stop if there are other vehicles around
option4: D) Honk to alert other drivers of your approach
correct_answer: B) Stop completely at the stop line, crosswalk, or intersection
explanation: At a stop sign, you must come to a complete stop before the stop line, crosswalk, or intersection, regardless of other vehicles.

question: What is the right-of-way rule when two vehicles arrive at an intersection without traffic signs or signals?
option1: A) The vehicle on the left has the right-of-way
option2: B) The vehicle on the right has the right-of-way
option3: C) The first vehicle to arrive at the intersection has the right-of-way
option4: D) The vehicle going straight has the right-of-way
correct_answer: B) The vehicle on the right has the right-of-way
explanation: If two vehicles arrive at an intersection at the same time and there are no traffic signs or signals, the vehicle on the right has the right-of-way.

question: When should you use your headlights while driving?
option2: B) Whenever visibility is poor or when driving in inclement weather
option3: C) Only when other vehicles use theirs
correct_answer: B) Whenever visibility is poor or when driving in inclement weather
explanation: Headlights should be used whenever visibility is reduced, such as during rain, fog, or at night.

question: What is the proper distance to maintain when following another vehicle on the road?
option3: C) Two seconds under normal conditions, or more in poor weather
correct_answer: C) Two seconds under normal conditions, or more in poor weather
explanation: Maintain a following distance of at least two seconds under normal conditions, and more if visibility or road conditions are poor.

question: What does a solid yellow line on your side of the road indicate?
option3: C) You are allowed to make a U-turn
explanation: A solid yellow line indicates that passing is not allowed in that lane.

question: When should you signal before turning?
option1: A) 100 feet before making the turn
option2: B) 200 feet before making the turn
option3: C) 300 feet before making the turn
option4: D) Only when there are other vehicles around
correct_answer: B) 200 feet before making the turn
explanation: You should signal at least 200 feet before making a turn to alert other drivers of your intention.

question: What does a flashing red traffic light mean?
option2: B) Stop completely and yield before proceeding
option3: C) Speed up to clear the intersection
correct_answer: B) Stop completely and yield before proceeding
explanation: A flashing red light works like a stop sign. You must stop completely and yield to other traffic or pedestrians before proceeding.

question: When is it legal to make a U-turn?
option1: A) Only when there are no vehicles approaching
option2: B) When the intersection is clear and there is a U-turn sign
option3: C) At any intersection, regardless of signage
option4: D) At intersections, but only when traffic signals allow it
correct_answer: B) When the intersection is clear and there is a U-turn sign
explanation: You may make a U-turn at an intersection when it is safe to do so and when there are no signs prohibiting it.

question: What should you do if you miss your exit on the freeway?
option1: A) Stop and back up to the exit
option2: B) Continue to the next exit and turn around
option3: C) Make a U-turn at the next exit
option4: D) Pull over and wait for help
correct_answer: B) Continue to the next exit and turn around
explanation: If you miss your exit, continue to the next exit and turn around safely. Do not stop, back up, or attempt illegal maneuvers on the freeway.

question: What is the rule for driving in a roundabout?
option1: A) Yield to traffic already in the roundabout
option2: B) Yield to vehicles entering from the right
option3: C) Vehicles inside the roundabout must yield to vehicles entering
option4: D) You can drive straight through without yielding
correct_answer: A) Yield to traffic already in the roundabout
explanation: When entering a roundabout, you must yield to traffic that is already in the roundabout to avoid collisions.
